comments:
I am getting following exception for quite some time now. Things were working fine before that. Problem occures when I  try to invoke an action from welcome page. The problem does not occure in development system. Problem occures in installed system only. We have three independent products and problem is occuring only in two of them. Code is same in all the three. As you can see from the trace, other classes from the same plugin jar are getting loaded.
And there is no other exception/error. I have tried running my application with -consolelog & -debig options. But did not find anything.
I am unable to figure out the cause.
Can you help me identify the problem. 

Application work fine after closing the welcome page. But things don't look good when first page itself is not working.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-07-12 17:25:06.703
!MESSAGE org/eclipse/ui/intro/config/IIntroAction
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/ui/intro/config/IIntroAction

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.model.loader.ModelLoaderUtil.createClassInstance(ModelLoaderUtil.java:187)

Can you check the dependencies of the plugin your IIntroAction is in? And make sure it specifically imports the intro plugin (or that package). It seems like it's getting to the point where it's trying to load your action, and since your action presumably is an IIntroAction it tries to load that first, and fails. This may be because you have some extra plugin in your dev environment that re-exports this plugin/package ?

I have "org.eclipse.ui.intro" in dependencies of my plugin which contains the action (implementing IIntroAction). And no other plugin has it in dependency. I have selected the exact set of plugins in my launch configuration (development system) which are bundled in the installed system. Also when I deselect the "org.eclipse.ui.intro" plugin from launch configuration and validate the plugin set, only one plugin which contains the action gets disabled.

Thanks,
Sudhan

Problem was in the build process. My intro plugin classes were getting bundled in one more plugin also. So my IntroAction class was getting loaded from that plugin.

Thanks,
Sudhan
